info.author: Brandon Craig Rhodes
info.description:
This package provides a ``cursive`` command that is intended to become
the core of a whole set of tools for working with `reStructured Text`_
documents.  The command supports sub-commands, some of which come
built-in with this package, and others that become available as other
cursive modules are installed.

The single built-in command available at this point is:

``cursive wc <filename>``
    Word count: ignoring headers, code snippets, and comments, this
    routine figures out the number of words in your document, and prints
    out a total both for each section of your document separately and
    also for the document as a whole.

The other module currently available to supplement cursive is the
`cursive.pymag`_ package, which will format an article for publication
in Python Magazine.

.. _reStructured Text: http://docutils.sourceforge.net/rst.html
.. _cursive.pymag: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/cursive.pymag/
info.name: cursive.tools
info.summary: Tools for authoring restructured text files
info.html_description:
This package provides a cursive command that is intended to become the core of a whole set of tools for working with reStructured Text documents. The command supports sub-commands, some of which come built-in with this package, and others that become available as other cursive modules are installed.

The single built-in command available at this point is:

cursive wc <filename>
Word count: ignoring headers, code snippets, and comments, this routine figures out the number of words in your document, and prints out a total both for each section of your document separately and also for the document as a whole.

The other module currently available to supplement cursive is the cursive.pymag package, which will format an article for publication in Python Magazine.
